intro: Nonatelia moralesii, commonly known as the Morales' nonatella, is a rare and unique species within the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the cloud forests of Ecuador, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central water-holding cup. Its flowering stems produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Nonatelia moralesii is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
